item.title: 理解系统负载
item.description: 理解系统负载 解决的问题 理解什么是load； 理解load值是多少合适； You might be familiar with Linux load averages already. Load averages are the three numbers shown with the uptime and top commands - they look like this: load average: 0.09, 0.05, 0.01 Most people have an inkling of what the load averages mean: the three numbers represent averages over progressively longer periods of time (one, five, and fifteen minute averages), and that lower numbers are better.
